trial_identification.studytitle: A psychosocial group program for the treatment of anxiety and depression in older adults (aged 60 years and older)
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised controlled trial of group cognitive behaviour therapy for older adults with comorbid anxiety and depression compared to wait list.

interventions.interventions: Group cognitive behaviour therapy focused on psychoeducation, cognitive restructuring, graded exposure, behavioural activation, problem solving, assertive communication, and sleep hygiene. The group problem involved 12 X 2 hour weekly sessions and was led by an intern psychologist.
interventions.comparator: Wait list condition of 12 weeks duration. At the end of the 12 week wait, participants completed post-assessments and then were offered participation in the next treatment group.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in diagnostic status and severity according to the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule, semi-structured clinical interview
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre, to post and 3 month follow up

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes on self-report measures: Geriatric Depression Inventory Geriatric Anxiety Inventory Centre for Epidemiological Studies- Depression Scale Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale Short Form -12
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pre to post treatment and at 3 month follow up

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Older adult Comorbid anxiety and depression as determined by clinical interview with the Anxiety Disorders Interview Schedule
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Moderate to severe dementia psychosis alcohol/drug abuse self-harm suicidal intentions Delirium Bipolar disorder

trial_design.concealment: Participants completed diagnostic interview. Suitable participants were then randomly allocated to treatment or waitlist condition based on apriori randomised allocation schedule. Allocation concealment involved contacting the holder of the allocation schedule.
trial_design.sequence: A random number generator was used to specify randomisation sequence for the full trial apriori

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of thsi study was to test the effectiveness of a group cognitive behaviour therapy program for older adults with comorbid anxiety and depression compared to a wait list condition. It was hypothesised that the group program would produce clinically significant and lasting improvements in anxiety and depression symptoms as comapred to the wait list condition.
